snippet: While some Brazilians are excited that their country is hosting the World Cup, others resent the event’s ballooning costs and a sluggish post-boom economy.
abstract: Brazil, host of 2014 World Cup soccer tournament, is marked by rifts, with some people genuinely excited about event while others are simmering with resentment over its ballooning costs and a sluggish post-boom economy; bitter strikes are roiling country's major cities.

byline.contributor: Lucy Jordan contributed reporting from Brasília.

lead_paragraph: While some Brazilians are excited that their country is hosting the World Cup, others resent the event’s ballooning costs and a sluggish post-boom economy.

headline.main: Brazil on Edge as World Cup Exposes Rifts
headline.print_headline: Brazil on Edge as World Cup Exposes Rifts
